metadata.title: CVE-2017-14340 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The XFS_IS_REALTIME_INODE macro in fs/xfs/xfs_linux.h in the Linux kernelbefore 4.13.2 does not verify that a filesystem has a realtime device,which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointerdereference and OOPS) via vectors related to setting an RHINHERIT flag on adirectory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14340` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-98-generic - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-lowlatency - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-4.4.0-98-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-98-generic - 4.4.0-98.121
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1076-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1076.84
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1078-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1078.83
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1

linux-image-4.13.0-32-lowlatency - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-32-generic - 4.13.0-32.35~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1033-gke - 4.4.0-1033.33
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1033-gke - 4.4.0-1033.33
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1005-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-4.10.0-1008-gcp - 4.10.0-1008.8
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1008-gcp - 4.10.0-1008.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-98.121').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1076.84').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1078.83').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1039.48').

linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1009.14').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1017.22~recert1').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
